arch:property.oc:show_val: the oven occured in the Sw quarter of the trench. At the top level that we found the oven the walls were not complete. But in the lower level it is. Also we found some greenish organic material in it. A little part seemed to be collapsed in becaue we found some clay reddish ditr in it. This oven was different than the other ones. Because the walls were a lot thinner and also very loose that while we were taking the walls off they were getting broke from the middle into two. As there was vry high temperature inside that destroyed the walls. Note that we found that slag pits in this area and strata.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: oven walls are not in very good condition/the pottery is thinner and not very strong relative to L4031
